title: Information disclosure of website
content:
NOTE! Thanks for submitting a report! Please fill all sections below with the pertinent details. Remember, the more detail you provide, the easier it is for us to verify and then potentially issue a bounty.
Summary:
Malicious application can see what the user is browsing
[add summary of the vulnerability]
Products affected:
BRave browser for android
operating system, Brave version or Brave website page, etc. Android Version Os : 4.4, App version:1.9.56 ## Steps To Reproduce: 1)Open adb shell 2)ps | grep "app process id" 3)logcat *:D | grep "process id of app"
YOu will see all the url that the user is browsing
List the steps needed to reproduce the vulnerability
Supporting Material/References:
List any additional material (e.g. screenshots, logs, etc.) http://www.androidsecurity.guru/category/logging/
steps: Run 'ps | grep "app process id"' to find the process ID of the Brave browser
Run 'logcat *:D | grep "process id of app"' to view the URLs the user is browsing
vuln_description: The vulnerability allows a malicious application to view the URLs a user is browsing in the Brave browser for Android by accessing logcat logs. This is an information disclosure issue where sensitive browsing data is exposed through system logs.
reason: The vulnerability involves a straightforward process of accessing system logs, which is a common technique for debugging. The steps are simple and do not require complex interactions or understanding of multiple components.
